subject: Music
title: The Mozart Effect Myth
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Mozart Effect Myth.

hook.text: In 1993, a study claimed Mozart makes you smarter. The world went crazy.

buildup.text: College students scored slightly higher on spatial tasks after listening to Mozart.

discovery.text: The effect lasted only 15 minutes and was never replicated reliably.

twist.text: Companies sold millions in Mozart CDs for babies â€” based on science that didn't hold up.

climax.text: Playing music does improve cognition â€” but just listening to Mozart doesn't make you a genius.

punchline.text: Mozart won't make you smarter. Learning to play him might.
